attractions.name: Idaho State Capitol
attractions.description: The Idaho State Capitol in Boise is a neoclassical building completed in 1920. Visitors can explore its marble columns, rotunda, and historical exhibits showcasing Idaho's political history.

attractions.name: Boise River Greenbelt
attractions.address: Spans 25 miles along the Boise River
attractions.description: A 25-mile tree-lined pathway following the Boise River through the heart of the city. Perfect for walking, jogging, cycling, and wildlife viewing with numerous parks and scenic spots along the way.

attractions.name: Boise Art Museum
attractions.description: Founded in 1937, the museum features contemporary works of art, ceramics, and photography exhibitions. The permanent collection includes over 4,000 works with a focus on 20th-century American art.

attractions.name: Idaho Botanical Garden
attractions.address: 2355 N Old Penitentiary Rd, Boise, ID 83712
attractions.description: A 15-acre living museum with themed gardens, plant collections, and seasonal displays. The garden hosts popular events like Winter Garden aGlow and summer concerts in a beautiful natural setting.

attractions.name: World Center for Birds of Prey
attractions.address: 5668 W Flying Hawk Ln, Boise, ID 83709
attractions.description: The headquarters of The Peregrine Fund, this center offers close encounters with eagles, falcons, and owls. Learn about conservation efforts and enjoy live raptor demonstrations.

attractions.name: Bogus Basin Mountain Recreation Area
attractions.address: 2600 N Bogus Basin Rd, Boise, ID 83702
attractions.description: A year-round recreation area just 16 miles from downtown Boise. Offers skiing and snowboarding in winter, and mountain biking, hiking, and scenic chairlift rides in summer.

attractions.name: Old Idaho Penitentiary
attractions.description: A historic prison that operated from 1872 to 1973. Now a museum where visitors can tour cell blocks, solitary confinement, and gallows while learning about prison life and notorious inmates.

attractions.name: Basque Block
attractions.address: Grove St between 6th and Capitol Blvd, Boise, ID 83702
attractions.description: A cultural district celebrating Boise's Basque heritage. Features the Basque Museum & Cultural Center, traditional restaurants, a community center, and distinctive public art.
